items.text: One Java 8 API which sometimes gets overlooked is the CompletionStage API, usually accessed through the CompletableFuture class.
items.href: How to make asynchronous API requests in Java using CompletableFutures

items.text: The CompletionStage API lets programmers define pipelines of asynchronous operations for data, and handles the asynchronous behaviour for you.
items.href: How to make asynchronous API requests in Java using CompletableFutures

items.text: You define what you want to happen, and Java takes care of when it can happen.
items.href: How to make asynchronous API requests in Java using CompletableFutures

items.text: You can schedule code to run after multiple CompletionStages have finished using CompletableFuture.allOf().
items.href: How to make asynchronous API requests in Java using CompletableFutures

items.text: If any exceptions are thrown in your asynchronous code, the CompletionStage API will catch them and let you handle them in a few different ways.
items.href: How to make asynchronous API requests in Java using CompletableFutures
